meanings.definition: Excessively controlling or dominating in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The overcontrolling parent never let their child make any decisions.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her overcontrolling nature in the office.
meanings.sent3: The overcontrolling chef insisted on personally seasoning every dish.
meanings.sent4: His overcontrolling grip on the project stifled creativity.
meanings.sent5: The overcontrolling teacher meticulously planned every aspect of the lesson.

meanings.definition: To exercise excessive control or authority over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overcontrolling his employees, which leads to low morale.
meanings.sent2: The manager tried to overcontrolling every aspect of the project.
meanings.sent3: The robot malfunctioned and started overcontrolling the entire factory.
meanings.sent4: The dictator's desire to overcontrolling the population led to unrest.
meanings.sent5: The overcontrolling supervisor micromanaged every task assigned to the team.
